results.title: Black Narcissus
results.creator_credit: Emeric Pressburger, Michael Powell, Archers Film Productions and GFD
results.brief_description: Obstacles in the life of a nun’s community high in the Himalayas range from a cynical British agent, suspicious natives, longings of the flesh, problems of faith and insanity to the arduous surrounding terrain. The mission prospers, but often at the expense of spiritual progress and although the nuns eventually retreat from the mission and the threatening terrain it is with a sense of having achieved some small spiritual gains. “One of the few genuinely erotic films to emerge from these sexually staid isles” said one critic. The glorious Oscar winning photography was a trick because it was shot in a London studio and backyard garden. The title refers to the intoxicating perfume worn by Indian Prince Sabu in his last major role. Based on the novel by Rumer Godden. Stars Deborah Kerr, David Farrar, Sabu, Jean Simmons, Flora Robson and Esmond Knight.

results.title: The Serpent's Egg
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Dino De Laurentiis and Rialto Film
results.brief_description: Berlin is at boiling point! Money is worthless and fear rules! Through the chaotic madness two people battle to keep their sanity… but what they uncover is far more dangerous than degradation and starvation…the human guinea pigs who risk insanity and death for a square meal. Starring Liv Ullman, David Carradine and James Whitmore.

results.title: The Postman always rings twice
results.creator_credit: Tay Garnett, Carey Wilson, Haworth Productions and ITC
results.brief_description: A beautiful woman involves her lover in a scheme to get rid of her much older husband. Lana Turner and John Garfield are excitingly partnered for a tense, even clinical drama of a crime of passion. Based on the novel by James M. Cain.

results.title: The More things change
results.creator_credit: Robyn Nevin, Jill Bilcock, Jill Robb, New South Wales Film Corporation and Syme International Productions
results.brief_description: A couple decide to give up living in the city and move to a farm, where the husband takes over the job of looking after their young son whilst his wife continues her city job. To alleviate the tension arising from the change in roles they hire a 19 year old live-in child minder who is also four months pregnant. Stars Judy Morris, Barry Otto and Victoria Longley.

results.title: Money movers
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Matt Carroll and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An armoured payroll van is attacked and robbed but this is merely an overture to a much larger multi-dollar theft by the members of a security company. Based on an actual incident and adapted from a book by Devon Minchin. Stars Bryan Brown, Terence Donovan and Tony Bonner.

results.title: D.P.: Displaced Person
results.creator_credit: Alan Bridges, Barry Levinson and HTV
results.brief_description: Based on the story by Kurt Vonnegut Jnr, author of Breakfast of Champions and Slaughterhouse Five. It’s the aftermath of the world’s greatest war. Allied occupied Germany, ravaged and shamed in defeat, must now pick up the pieces. One of those pieces is a small black orphan boy named Tobias. Abandoned at a cold and dismal orphanage, he dreams - despite jeers from the other embittered children - of his courageous father’s return from war to claim him. When Tobias meets his first black man, he’s convinced the G.I. sergeant is the father of his dreams.

results.title: Long weekend
results.brief_description: A young couple decide to spend a long weekend away in the bush together in an attempt to save their failing marriage. They head for a beach so isolated that even the locals have not heard of it. Strange things begin to happen, including the disappearance of their dog and then the girl herself. Cast includes John Hargreaves and Briony Behets.

results.title: Libido
results.creator_credit: David Baker, Fred Schepisi, John B Murray, Tim Burstall and Producers and Directors Guild of Australia
results.brief_description: Libido is a motivating force that guides, directs and even shares a personality. The film’s scope encompasses four people of distinctly different backgrounds - a husband, a child, a family man and a priest. Each is dealt within a separate piece directed by four different filmmakers. Scriptwriters include Hal Porter, Thomas Kenneally and David Williamson. Cast: (The Husband) Elke Neidhardt, Bryon Williams ; (The Child) John Williams, Jill Forster ; (The Priest) Robyn Nevin, Arthur Dignam ; (The Family Man) Jack Thompson, Max Gillies.

results.title: The Last bastion
results.creator_credit: Chris Thomson, Brian Rosen and Network Ten (Australia)
results.brief_description: Set in Australia in 1942 and concerning the threat of Japanese invasion, this is a drama about the characters and events of the time in Australian history in which the inner cabinet of Australia’s coalition war government played a major role. The distinguished cast includes Timothy West, Robert Vaughn, John Wood, Michael Blakemore, Warren Mitchell and Ray Barrett. David Williamson co-wrote the script.

results.title: Lady stay dead
results.brief_description: A girl visits her film star sister in a beach resort only to discover clues to a macabre murder. A psychotic gardener preys on his female employers, murdering them in a variety of grisly ways.
